alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 5:51PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wasatch...east central Salt Lake...southwestern Summit and northern Utah Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 550 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wasatch Mountain State Park, or 8 miles southwest of Park City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Park City, Kamas, Francis, South Snyderville Basin, Samak, Little Cottonwood Canyon, North Snyderville Basin, Wasatch Mountain State Park, Big Cottonwood Canyon, Midway, Alta, Brighton, Snowbird, Snyderville, Hailstone and Jordanelle Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 146 and 149. US Route 40 between mile markers 0 and 14. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains
